name: duster
content:
duster noun [C]
(FOR CLEANING)
Add to word list
Add to word list
UK (US dustcloth) a piece of cloth that is used for removing dust from furniture, books, surfaces, etc.: She used his old T-shirt as a duster.
US (UK feather duster) a stick with feathers at one end, or a similar object with cloth attached to one end, used for cleaning: The cartoon depicted the President in an apron holding a duster.
CHAIWATPHOTOS/iStock / Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesHe tore one of mum's dusters into strips for tying up the bundles of sticks.A clout means a cloth, rag, dishcloth, or duster.Give children chores where they don't risk breaking anything, such as using a duster.a duster made out of ostrich feathers
